meanings.definition: The act of pushing something back.
meanings.sent1: She gave the door a strong pushback to close it.
meanings.sent2: The pushback of the waves against the shore was powerful.
meanings.sent3: The pushback of the chair made it look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The pushback of the crowd at the concert was like a tidal wave.
meanings.sent5: The pushback of the spring-loaded toy was unexpected and made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: Resistance or opposition to a plan or idea.
meanings.sent1: There was a lot of pushback from the team about changing the project deadline.
meanings.sent2: The pushback from the community delayed the construction of the new building.
meanings.sent3: The pushback from the cat against taking a bath was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The pushback from the market towards the new product was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The pushback from the students made the teacher rethink her lesson plan.
